00030 #import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
00031 
00032 @class WebRequest;
00033 
00101 @interface WebModelBase : NSObject <NSCopying> /* Also implements JSONRepresentation */ {
00102  BOOL  m_notPersisted;
00103  NSString* uid;
00104  
00105  @private
00106  NSMutableDictionary* m_data;
00107  NSMutableArray* m_dirtyKeys;
00108  NSMutableDictionary* m_datasource_data;
00109 }
00110 //Class and actual name as set by -identifierName and -identifierClass
00111 @property (nonatomic, retain) NSString* uid;
00112 
00113 /*
00114  WebDataSources should call this to initial an object based on existing datasource data
00115  */
00116 - (id)initFromDatabase;
00117 
00118 /*
00119  Subclasses should simply define their properties as normal object -c 2.0 properties, or kvo accessable properties
00120  or by implementing valueForKey and setValue:forKey kvo methods
00121  */
00122 
00123 //The data source name to use. The defualt is "Defualt"
00124 + (NSString*)dataSourceName;
00125 
00126 //Subclasses can overide this to provide a custom model name, the defualt is the Class name -Model <RemoteModelName> or <Class>Model
00127 + (NSString*)modelName;
00128 
00129 //For alternate identifer names, If this does not match the datasource's internal name, then implementations should use +dataSourceKeyForPersistableKey for replacing
00130 + (NSString*)identifierName;
00131 
00132 //For integers return NSNumber, for guids return NSString. Defualt is NSString/guid
00133 + (Class)identifierClass;
00134 
00135 //Must return the list of all persistable keys
00136 + (NSArray*)allPersistableKeys;
00137 
00138 //Subclasses can overide this to return TRUE for dynamicly adding new values with -setValue:forKey: without haveing a schema. Some models may not support this. */
00139 + (BOOL)hasStaticKeys;
00140 
00141 /*
00142  Offers a subclass the ability to substatute a datasource name for a local property name, Data sources
00143  can take this into account in their implementations.
00144  
00145  Typically this is used in correspondance with 
00146  + (NSString*)persistableKeyForDataSourceKey:(NSString*)key
00147  for the reverse direction.
00148  */
00149 + (NSString*)dataSourceKeyForPersistableKey:(NSString*)key;
00150 + (NSString*)persistableKeyForDataSourceKey:(NSString*)key;
00151 
00152 //Standard Lookups / Creation
00153 + (NSArray*)all;
00154 + (NSArray*)findAllWithConditions:(NSDictionary *)conditions;
00155 
00156 + (id)findFirstWithConditions:(NSDictionary *)conditions;
00157 + (int)countWithConditions:(NSDictionary *)conditions;
00158 
00166 + (NSArray*)findWithQuery:(NSString*)query;
00167 
00169 + (id)objectWithIdentifier:(NSString *)identifier;
00170 
00172 - (id)init;
00173 
00175 + (id)createWithProperties:(NSDictionary*)dictionary;
00176 
00178 + (id)createWithXML:(NSXMLNode*)node;
00179 
00181 + (id)createWithPostRequest:(WebRequest*)request;
00182 
00183 //Also supports...
00184 /*
00185   -find<All | First>By_<key>:(id)keyValue;
00186   -find<All | First>By_<key>:(id)keyValue <or | and>_<key>:(id)keyValue;
00187   -find<All | First>By_<key>:(id)keyValue and_<key>:(id)keyValue and_<key>:(id)keyValue;
00188   -countOf_<key>:(id)keyValue;
00189  */
00190 
00191 //Calls the dataSource's implementation for transactional support
00192 + (void)beginTransactions;
00193 + (void)endTransactions;
00194 
00198 - (BOOL)save;
00199 
00200 - (void)didSaveForCreate;
00201 - (void)didSaveForDelete;
00202 - (void)didSaveForUpdate;
00203 
00210 - (BOOL)delete;
00211 
00212 //Basic Structure Info
00213 - (BOOL)hasAttribute:(NSString*)key;
00214 
00215 //An array of keys that have changes since last save
00216 - (NSArray*)dirtyKeys;
00217 - (BOOL)isDirty;
00218 - (void)dirty:(NSString*)key;
00219 - (void)makeClean;
00220 
00221 /*
00222  This data can be used by datasources for storing data source specific info. Subclasses
00223  can utilize this data according to the datasources specifictionm
00224  */
00225 - (NSMutableDictionary*)dataSourceData;
00226 
00227 /*
00228  Returns the current backing data dictionary for the current state of the object
00229  Data sources that allow for write all, should use this if +hasStaticKeys returns NO
00230  */
00231 - (NSDictionary*)data;
00232 
00243 - (NSDictionary*)dictionaryRepresentation;
00244 
00245 @end
